Class ec.e.util.SimpleQueue 
All Packages  Class Hierarchy  This Package  Previous  Next  Index

Class ec.e.util.SimpleQueue 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----ec.e.util.SimpleQueue
public class SimpleQueue
extends Object
A SimpleQueue is a stream of entries with two sides, the reader and the writer. The SimpleQueueReader will enumerate all the elements added to the queue so far, in the order they were written. Using the SimpleQueueWriter, one can add further entries to the queue, which the SimpleQueueReader will then be able to enumerate.

The SimpleQueue class itself is an artifact of not being able to return multiple values in Java. Better would have simply been to have a constructor that directly returned both reader and writer.

The SimpleQueue's internal data structure is a "half-party", it is half of the party data structure invented by Norm, Dean, et al, for use in Channels. The SimpleQueue is "simple" by contrast with ec.e.util.crew.Queue, which supports multi-threaded use. The SimpleQueue interface is a strict subset of the Queue interface, and the Queue is fully upwards compatible from the SimpleQueue.

See Also:
Queue, SimpleQueueReader, SimpleQueueWriter

SimpleQueue()
Creates a new SimpleQueue.

reader()
for consuming queue elements
writer()
for producing queue elements

  public SimpleQueue()
